A number of people are using abbot (http://abbot.sf.net) for SWT.   
The library is designed for component-level testing.  There is a  
higher scripting layer more tailored to testing applications.

On Sep 21, 2006, at 12:53 PM, Kamal Ahmed wrote:

>
> I would like to take a look at the framework which you have developed.
>
> For the simulation testing, I am looking at
> http://jemmy.netbeans.org/samples.html
> <http://jemmy.netbeans.org/samples.html>  to see if it can also be  
> used for
> Eclipse UI's.
>
>
> The user tests should be plug-in tests that come as close as  
> possible to
>
> simulating user actions and testing UI appearance, down to simulating
>
> mouse clicks (I've recently written a framework that makes this much
>
> easier, but it's not clear yet whether it will be released.   
> Working on
>
> such a thing on your own, if you get time and permission, can teach  
> you
>
> a lot about how Eclipse is built).
>
>
